definition: (literary) to die by hanging or strangulation
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
to execute by hanging/to hang oneself
the pretense of acting on imperial order

Zhu Wen (852-912), military governor 節度使|节度使[jie2 du4 shi3] at the end of Tang, founder of Later Liang of the Five Dynasties (907-923), also known as Emperor Taizu of Later Liang 後梁太祖|后梁太祖[Hou4 Liang2 Tai4 zu3]
(literary) to die by hanging or strangulation
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
to hand down an imperial edict
An Lushan (703-757), Tang general, leader of the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Emperor Zhaozong of Tang, reign name of twentieth Tang emperor 李曄|李晔[Li1 Ye4] (867-904), reigned 888-904
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
Emperor Zhongzong of Tang, reign name of fourth Tang emperor Li Zhe 李哲[Li3 Zhe2] (656-710), reigned 705-710
Emperor Xianzong of Tang (778-820), reign name of twelfth Tang emperor Li Chun 李純|李纯[Li3 Chun2] reigned 805-820
posthumous name given to second emperor of a dynasty/King Taejong of Joseon Korea (1367-1422), reigned 1400-1418
